question: A sum of ₹12,000 is compounded annually at 10% for 3 years. What is the compound amount?
Two pipes can fill a tank in 20 and 30 minutes respectively. A third pipe can empty it in 15 minutes. If all pipes are opened together, how long will it take to fill the tank?
A person covers a certain distance downstream in 6 hours and returns upstream in 9 hours. If the speed of the boat in still water is 12 km/h, what is the speed of the stream?
A shopkeeper sells an article at a profit of 20%. If he had bought it for 10% less and sold it for ₹60 more, the profit percentage would have been 40%. What is the cost price of the article?
The ratio of the ages of A and B is 4:5. After 5 years, the ratio will be 5:6. What is the present age of A?
A sum becomes ₹7,200 in 2 years and ₹7,776 in 3 years at compound interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
The average of five consecutive multiples of 3 is 63. What is the largest number?
If a sum of money is doubled in 8 years at simple interest, in how many years will it triple?
A and B can do a piece of work in 12 days, B and C in 15 days, and A and C in 20 days. In how many days can A, B, and C do the work together?
The compound interest on a sum at 5% per annum for 3 years, compounded annually, is ₹1,576.25. Find the sum.
